post_text: School is canceled today 11/12/19. Elementary Parent Teacher Conferences scheduled for today are also canceled and they will be scheduled for a later date.
text: School is canceled today 11/12/19. Elementary Parent Teacher Conferences scheduled for today are also canceled and they will be scheduled for a later date.

post_text:
Due to the weather, both high schools and both middle schools will be released early today, 11/11/2019.

The high schools will release at 1:30 p.m. and both middle schools will release at 2:00 p.m. All elementary schools will maintain their dismissal times. The early releases of the secondary schools will allow us to maintain the elementary transportation schedules. Supervision at the secondary schools will maintain their schedules to accommodate parent pick-up.

The Board of Education study session will continue as scheduled this evening. All other evening events are canceled tonight.

Thank you for your understanding and flexibility as we navigate through this wintery day.
text:

The early releases of the secondary schools will allow us to maintain the elementary transportation schedules. Supervision at the secondary schools will maintain their schedules to accommodate parent pick-up.

The Board of Education study session will continue as scheduled this evening. All other evening events are canceled tonight.

Thank you for your understanding and flexibility as we navigate through this wintery day.

post_text:
A free event for families being held this Saturday at our Royal Oak Campus theater. Explore familiar stories through a new lens with Eisenhower Dance and Detroit Chamber Winds & Strings. Featuring original contemporary dance and live music, these art forms combine with the story and illustrations to create a unique experience fun for the whole family.

After each performance, audience members will be invited to get hands-on with the instruments in a special Musical Petting Zoo from McCourt Music and/or meet the dancers in a short participatory exercise.
text:
A free event for families being held this Saturday at our Royal Oak Campus theater. Explore familiar stories through a new lens with Eisenhower Dance and Detroit Chamber Winds & Strings. Featuring original contemporary dance and live music, these art forms combine with the story and illustrations to create a unique experience fun for the whole family.

After each performance, audience members will be invited to get hands-on with the instruments in a special Musical Petting Zoo from McCourt Music and/or meet the dancers in a short participatory exercise.

post_text: South Lyon Community Schools will be canceled Tuesday, February 12, 2019, due to the weather conditions. Please be careful and safe today.
text: South Lyon Community Schools will be canceled Tuesday, February 12, 2019, due to the weather conditions. Please be careful and safe today.

post_text: South Lyon Community Schools will be canceled Wednesday, February 6, 2019, due to the weather conditions. Please be careful and safe today.
text: South Lyon Community Schools will be canceled Wednesday, February 6, 2019, due to the weather conditions. Please be careful and safe today.

post_text: South Lyon Community Schools will be closing schools Wednesday, January 30, 2019, and Thursday, January 31, 2019, due to the dangerously cold temperatures predicted for the area. The risk of frostbite is extremely high making the conditions dangerous for everyone. Governor Gretchen Whitmer declared a state of emergency due to the forecast. We will be monitoring conditions for Friday, February 1, 2019, and are currently planning to have school on Friday. If we are able to have school Friday we will have a half-day for the middle schools and high schools and a full day for elementary students. The secondary students will complete their exams for 5th and 6th hours. We will use our typical outlets if we decide to cancel school on Friday.
text: South Lyon Community Schools will be closing schools Wednesday, January 30, 2019, and Thursday, January 31, 2019, due to the dangerously cold temperatures predicted for the area. The risk of frostbite is extremely high making the conditions dangerous for everyone. Governor Gretchen Whitmer declared a state of emergency due to the forecast. We will be monitoring conditions for Friday, February 1, 2019, and are currently planning to have school on Friday. If we are able to have school Friday we will have a half-day for the middle schools and high schools and a full day for elementary students. The secondary students will complete their exams for 5th and 6th hours. We will use our typical outlets if we decide to cancel school on Friday.

post_text: South Lyon Community Schools is canceled January 28, 2019 due to weather. Please be safe if you have to travel tomorrow. Secondary students will take their 3rd and 4th hour exams on Tuesday. Tuesday will remain a half day for all students for exams and the teacher’s records day. Keep in mind that our county cancels school if wind chills are extreme and dangerous which is in the forecast later this week. We will continue to monitor the weather.

post_text:
Invited by FIRST robotics Team 3770, BlitzCreek. from Midland, Michigan, the Flying Toasters, Team 3641, traveled to the Herbert H Dow High School in Midland Michigan to participate in the post season event, Great Lake Bot Bash. Early Saturday morning, Team 3641 progressed through the 6 qualification matches while changing up drive teams and having students present rotate through being on the field. Then came the Playoffs. Being the first pick from the 6th seed alliance, the Toasters went on to become event finalists in their first ever attendance at the Great Lakes Bot Bash. Further, they went on to win the Geared Up Bot award (Engineering Inspiration award), celebrating a veteran team that takes on helping GB and promoting new teams while still maintaining that competition spirit.
Way to go Toasters!

For more info on the team, check out thebluealliance or our website theflyingtoasters.org
text:
Invited by FIRST robotics Team 3770, BlitzCreek. from Midland, Michigan, the Flying Toasters, Team 3641, traveled to the Herbert H Dow High School in Midland Michigan to participate in the post season event, Great Lake Bot Bash. Early Saturday morning, Team 3641 progressed through the 6 qualification matches while changing up drive teams and having students present rotate through being on the field. Then came the Playoffs. Being the first pick from the 6th seed alliance, the Toasters went on to become event finalists in their first ever attendance at the Great Lakes Bot Bash. Further, they went on to win the Geared Up Bot award (Engineering Inspiration award), celebrating a veteran team that takes on helping GB and promoting new teams while still maintaining that competition spirit.
Way to go Toasters!

For more info on the team, check out thebluealliance or our website theflyingtoasters.org

shared_text:
Michigan Office of Retirement Services
January 4, 2018 at 4:41 PM ·

If you’re a retiree who’s receiving a refund of 3% healthcare contributions, please make sure we’ve got your correct street address, email address, and phone number. We are providing retiree addresses to the school districts. Update your address in miAccount using these instructions. First, log in at www.michigan.gov/orsmiaccount. Click the Update Address & Phone link on the left. Click the Edit link to the right of your address. Enter your new physical address. If you live in Michigan, select your county if requested. Click Yes or No to indicate if you want your Physical Address to be the same as your Mailing address. Click the Continue button at the bottom of the page.

Click Yes or No to indicate if you want your Physical Address to be the same as your Mailing address. Click the Continue button at the bottom of the page.

post_text:
The National Prescription Drug Take Back Day - SATURDAY OCT 28 - addresses a crucial public safety and public health issue. According to the 2015 National Survey on Drug Use and Health, 6.4 million Americans abused controlled prescription drugs. The study shows that a majority of abused prescription drugs were obtained from family and friends, often from the home medicine cabinet.

The DEA’s Take Back Day events provide an opportunity for Americans to prevent drug addiction and overdose deaths.

To find a site to return unused medication, go to
https://takebackday.dea.gov/

text: Dolsen and Pearson Elementary Schools and Kids Clubs will be closed on Tuesday October 10 due to lack of power.

post_text: Tues 10/10 - Dolsen and Pearson Kids Club delayed until 7:30 am due to power issues. We anticipate restoration in time for a full day of school as usual.
text: Tues 10/10 - Dolsen and Pearson Kids Club delayed until 7:30 am due to power issues. We anticipate restoration in time for a full day of school as usual.

post_text:
Power and potential phone issues:
Due to downed power lines in the area, some of our buildings may be running on reduced or back up power at this time. It is possible that this could affect the phone system intermittently as well, although we have not yet experienced difficulties. If you experience an issue, please try again. Email is working throughout the district.
